hello.title: It is Muto Tsujimoto.
hello.message: I am working on the systems and apps, which can solve the problems to make the users much more comfortable.

cards.title: LINE Bot Service
cards.description:
We introduced LINE's Messaging API to make progress management easier than ever for those who work on the front line. "Flex Message" enables the user experience to be as easy as common web services. 
 Just by asking "When will you finish work today?", the bot will automatically answer the question based on the current progress.

cards.title: Progress Management System
cards.description: By displaying the data acquired from the "progress data collection system" as a table or graph on the browser, anyone can easily grasp the progress and abnormalities. By using WebSocket to receive progress data, the latest data is always displayed.

infomations.title: Languages
infomations.data: C#, SQL, Typescript, HTML, CSS, Ladder logic

cards.title: Operator Call App
cards.description: Call the forklift operator when the product is ready to be unloaded. By recording "who" called "when" and "where" in the database so that the operator can check it immediately, the waste of transportation work has been greatly reduced.

cards.title: Progress Data Collection System
cards.description: Communicate with PLC (programmable logic controller) in the factory using Socket. Reads the value of the sensor connected to the PLC and writes it to the database. By performing processing asynchronously, it is possible to acquire data in a 100ms cycle.

cards.title: Design Support System
cards.description: We have built a system that can complete clerical processing related to design work such as management of drawings and property information, output of forms, recording of processing time, and calculation of productivity. Not only does it reduce the wasted time that occurs each time, but it also enables clear management.

contents.heading: Nice to meet you
texts: I've been learning programming and web design on my own, starting with my parents giving me a computer when I was in fourth grade.
At the company I am currently working for, I am the only system engineer in my department, and I develop and design systems alone.
I have often been in charge of system-related hardware, producing interactive devices using the Raspberry Pi and sensor I/O devices using PLCs to promote IoT at production sites.
Some of the works that have been approved by the company are posted on the "works" page.

contents.heading: Special skill
texts: It's about finding a problem and developing a full stack of systems and apps that lead to a solution.
In my current job, I do a total of planning, requirements definition, design and development, and then release the product.

Since this is a one-man operation, we also maintain things we have developed in the past by ourselves, but we do unit tests in advance and prepare manuals for troubleshooting, etc. to reduce the cost of response.

rows.title: Languages
rows.data: C#, Java, Python, Typescript, Javascript, Dart, SQL, HTML, CSS

rows.title: OS
rows.data: CentOS, Apple macOS, Microsoft Windows Server

rows.title: Cloud Platforms
rows.data: Amazon Web Service, Google Cloud Platform
OAuth Authorization Server Development (I did it full scratch to understand how it works)

contact: If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at the email address below.
